letters.description: Conduct a comprehensive assessment of the caregiver’s current environment, primary stressors, and the specific needs of the care recipient.
Define realistic milestones for care management while establishing clear personal boundaries to protect the caregiver's autonomy.
Identify and mobilize external support systems, including community services, financial aid, and medical networks, to distribute the care load.
Design and implement non-negotiable daily restorative practices and scheduled respite to mitigate the risk of clinical burnout.
Develop psychological resilience through emotional regulation tools, grief processing, and cognitive reframing of the caregiving role.
Equip the caregiver with communication and leadership skills to navigate healthcare systems and manage a sustainable long-term support team.
